channel.name: After CircuitValue got deprecated how to adapt existing classes?

messages.content:
I am finishing up my milestones, realized Berkeley is deprecated so I have to switch to DevNet and that requires updating o1js to a version that no longer supports CircuitValue type.

My code is full of custom classes which extend CircuitValue. Suddenly I have to manually implement toFields and fromFields methods everywhere…

Is there some other way? Having automatically serialisation / deserialisation of CircuitValue was a great convenience for me as it was easy to hash everything…

This made me think its deprecated https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#0180---2024-04-09 but after reading PR https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/pull/1507 and current sources I see `CircuitValue` is still very much present. It's just it can no longer be imported as
```typescript
import { CircuitValue, prop } from 'o1js';
```
no longer works.

embeds.title: Refactor provable core by mitschabaude · Pull Request #1507 · o1-la...
embeds.description:
The general goal here is to make the structure of core provable code more logical.
closes #1504

get rid of several import cycles surrounding Field, by introducing a low-level stub module field-con...

messages.content: I opened a PR https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/pull/1695 this solves my problem

embeds.title: Bringing back CircuitValue, prop and arrayProp by marekyggdrasil · ...
embeds.description:
Ref: https://discord.com/channels/484437221055922177/1254021497727746088
After this change I am able to correctly inherit CircuitValue and use prop

messages.content:
CircuitValue used to be deprecated and was removed along with all the other deprecated APIs before moving to 1.0

I don't want to reintroduce it.

It should be pretty easy to refactor your circuit values to Struct!

@renzokuken here's how to use Struct, it is the successor for CircuitValue, and implements toFields etc for you:
https://docs.minaprotocol.com/zkapps/writing-a-zkapp/introduction-to-zkapps/smart-contracts#custom-data-types

embeds.title: Mina Documentation
embeds.description: Website for documentation about Mina Protocol

messages.content:
Btw you can hash any provable type with 

Poseidon.hashPacked(type, value)
@gregor so all classes such as UInt32 and UInt64 which still use CircuitValue are going to be changed into Struct ?
Not sure, Struct also has its issues. But they won't use CircuitValue
Struct is great for simple compositions of existing types I would say

I am not entirely sure if Struct will be sufficient and there is only few days for milestones submission so I will go for now with my custom fork of o1js and consider refactoring into struct in the future.
That's understandable! There's nothing that you can't do with Struct but can with CircuitValue though
It's typed more strictly though
Good to know!
thank you, let me try
depending on what you want for your codebase
@renzokuken and to turn this Struct into fields you do `Point.toFields(myPoint)` (it's all static methods)

similarly, I can't do
```typescript
const deserialized: Participant = Participant.fromFields(serialized);
```
because
```
error TS2739: Type '{ participant_address: PublicKey; }' is missing the following properties from type 'Participant': pk, serialize, toBytes
```
( methods are missing )
As I said, `toFields` is a static method
`Participant.toFields()`

for `fromFields()` the problem is that the class that is defined by `Struct({ ... })` doesn't know about any of your instance methods you defined on the extended class. so it's fundamentally impossible in TS for the base `fromFields()` to return a properly typed object. (the actual JS object is an instance of `Participant` though, TS just doesn't know about it)

you can solve this by doing
```ts
const deserialized: Participant = new Participant(Participant.fromFields(serialized));
```
(assuming you didn't override the constructor and changed its arguments)
to make it cleaner, you could also override the `fromFields` method to wrap `super.fromFields()` in a `Participants` instance

Thank you. For some reason I written those buffer methods two years ago, for some reason I did not use the `fromFields` of `CircuitValue` so maybe I actually don't needed. Thanks a lot for replying some quickly.
@gregor sorry another question... https://gist.github.com/marekyggdrasil/a462fe1b2680ff23fc1fb82ba4496b91 (it was too long to paste here so I created a gist)

messages.content: That doesn't sound right, can't you pass <Outcome> as the type hint?
It's not removing the methods
just do new MyStruct(provable.if…) and call it a day
we struggle with this for Protokit struct apis too
just <Outcome> wouldn't work, had to do this type trick to make it work, I will try what @maht0rz suggested after I'll finish my milestones
This thread collects a lot of the reasons why I'm not happy with `Struct` actually

For newer provable types like `IndexedMerkleMap` or `ForeignField` I added a static `.provable` property which implements `Provable<Class>` for the class itself, including all its methods. That makes the types much more straight-forward
When checking if a type is `never` in a conditional type, the predicate should be expressed in a tuple / like so: `[T] extends [never] ? A : B`
Otherwise it'll always evaluate as a match
(pointing to the `[K in keyof...` within `FilterNever`)
